com.esri.mo2.ui.menu
Interface MenuProvider

All Known Implementing Classes:
ContextMenuProvider
public interface MenuProvider

The defines a plugin interface that is managed by MenuManager. Certain dialogs and applications can choose to make the menu definitions pluggable. I this case, the dialog or application will define a subclass of MenuProvider, then use the MenuManager to construct the menus defined by service providers that define implementations of the MenuProvider subclass. This approach is used, so that multiple dialogs within a single application can have separate pluggable menus without conflict.

See Also:
MenuManager

Method Summary
 JMenu[] getMenus()
          provides zero or more JMenu objects that will be added into the collection of menus produced by MenuManager.constructMenus.

          the given list contains an initial collection of menus that will be returned by MenuManager.constructMenus.
 

Method Detail

getMenus

public JMenu[] getMenus()
provides zero or more JMenu objects that will be added into the collection of menus produced by MenuManager.constructMenus. These menus will be subject to further possible modification by MenuProviders within modifyMenus. It is Ok to return null, indicating that no menus are returned by this MenuProvider, in this case a MenuProvider is most likely going to only make modifications to existing menus.

Returns:
the array of JMenus to be added to the menu collection, or null == no menus

modifyMenus

public void modifyMenus(LinkedList menuList)
the given list contains an initial collection of menus that will be returned by MenuManager.constructMenus. A MenuProvider has the opportunity to modify the list - by removing menus from the collection, or by removing items within each of the menus, or by adding new items to the menus. N

Parameters:
menuList -
